history.content:
Am currently taking 182. Took 189 before. I think the main thing to understand with this class is that it covers a huge breadth of material and pulls from several courses at Berkeley and Stanford. We go through vision, nlp, gans, rl, etc. I think that they "technically" cover all the prereqs, but the lecture moves through them fairly quickly, and I don't know if the concepts would 100% sink in. So it makes life a little easier to know stuff from 189. If not you can totally do fine in the class, but you'll be spending a lot of time focusing on the 189 aspect of the course when the focus is really more on design and applications of deep learning. So taking 189, while not strictly necessary, helps.

For your second question, the main "prereq" would be 189 and some coding background. I don't think anything else is necessary. I think it does help if you have knowledge about a specific domain covered in the course (like vision/NLP/RL) because the professor does go through research papers in lecture, but again not strictly necessary.

children.subject:
1. As someone who took 189 before 182, I don't think 189 is very necessary for 182. 189 is very math heavy, while 182 is very conceptual and involves minimal math.

2. I think you are in good shape!

history.content:
Hi all, tried searching the thread but couldn't find any specific answers for what I was looking for.. so just had a few questions about CS 182.

1. Berkeley's class guide suggests CS 189 is done prior to doing cs 182, would you say that 189 is necessary to make 182 significantly easier, more understandable? For CS upper divs, I've done 188 and data 100 only so far. 

2. With respect to the prereqs (Math 53, Math 54, CS189, CS70/Stat134, CS61B), I'll have done all except CS189. I did 16A+16B instead of 54, and will do stat 140 in place of 134. Is there anything else that should be done otherwise to prep that isn't otherwise listed? 

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: What pre-reqs are needed for CS 182?
